content: Would it make sense to have a list of our own topics i.e the topics created by us to be easily accessible from somewhere in the GUI?
It is sometimes difficult to keep track.
that has been suggested before, in various forms eg "topics followed by me", "my topics", "favorite conversations" and is probably on the issue tracker, I believe.
yay, it seems like we've figured out that we'd like to try this out https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/6605
we just need someone to work on it, it'd probably be a cool/fun frontend project

you can give it a shot, if you feel like you'd be able to, Arunika Yadav.
Otherwise, I'll give it a shot when I have time.

@Mohit Gupta were you able to make any progress on this?
Even if you have a preliminary, rough draft PR someone else could benefit from looking at it.
Sure @Yash RE that already has some work in progress I guess, so should I take it from there?

OH. I hadn't seen that WIP PR, I'm sorry.

I believe that PR may have just stagnated because of time and @Rohitt Vashishtha may or may not want to hand it off to someone else to continue stage 2 and onward, I think it's just best to wait for Tim or Rohitt to comment here, so that it's clear how to proceed.

cc: @Tim Abbott.
(I'm not quite familiar with progress on that feature so I don't know what actually happened and why it stagnated, inconvenient timing is just my best guess)
I think we could just reuse a rewrite of the PR. Some of the internals have likely changed a bit since I last rebased it.

@Arunika Yadav so, I think it's best if you try to understand how the code and relevant functions are working in the PR, and then perform a rebase and ensure that everything is working well from on top of master, and once that is done, you can begin doing stage 2.

(btw, since you're a new developer, I'd like to remind you that you can always ask around here if you get stuck or confused)
Are you familiar with how to do a rebase?
@Yash RE as far I can remember it was not a priority during last GSoC so didn't work much on it and focused on other assigned stuff
I can look into it
When can we claim more than one issues?

sure, don't worry too much about "claiming it" if you've already got another issue... just leave a comment that you're working on it so no one else takes it, but if you don't make a PR/ add post on it again/ make any referencing commits, someone will (fairly) assume that you've abandoned it.

(although if you do abandon it, just mention that in another comment so its 100% clear that it's available for someone else to work on)

:)

@Arunika Yadav did you start working on this yet? I could rebase that PR now and see how the internal data structures might have changed since 2018 when I made that PR if you haven't started the work yet. :slight_smile:
Sure @Rohitt Vashishtha that will be great
